newsitem.title: TAIWAN: FORECAST-Taiwan Dec export orders --Reuters poll.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-Taiwan Dec export orders --Reuters poll.

text.p: The following Reuter poll of economists gives their projections for year-on-year growth for Taiwan's export orders in December.
The figures are due to be released by the economics ministry at around 0230 GMT on January 20.
November's export orders fell 4.16 percent year-on-year.
The poll results produced an average forecast for a rise of 1.64 percent in annual export orders growth in December.
Economists said they expected relatively slow growth or even a decline because local manufacturers had yet to complete adjustments to their product stocks.
"The electronics industry in particular has not finished its stock adjustment in December," said Nikko Securities research chief Michael Hung.
But they said trade with Hong Kong was seen improving.

"Easing tension between Taiwan and China has enabled Taiwan-Hong Kong trade to recover gradually, and this should contribute to a small growth in December's export orders," said Nomura Securities economist Amy Huang.
